meanings.definition: A current of air flowing inwards.
meanings.sent1: The indraughts from the open window made the room feel chilly.
meanings.sent2: The basement had a musty smell due to the indraughts coming through the vents.
meanings.sent3: As the door opened, the indraughts played a game of tag with the curtains.
meanings.sent4: The indraughts of inspiration swept through her mind, sparking new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The indraughts carried the scent of fresh flowers into the room, brightening the atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The act of drawing in or inhaling.
meanings.sent1: His indraughts of breath were deep and steady as he practiced meditation.
meanings.sent2: The doctor instructed her patient to take slow, deep indraughts to calm down.
meanings.sent3: The comedian exaggerated his indraughts dramatically, pretending to inhale a whole balloon.
meanings.sent4: With each indraught, she felt the fresh air filling her lungs, rejuvenating her.
meanings.sent5: The indraughts of the ocean breeze invigorated him, clearing his mind of worries.

meanings.definition: A tendency or inclination towards a particular direction or action.
meanings.sent1: Her indraughts of curiosity led her to explore the mysterious old house.
meanings.sent2: The indraughts of enthusiasm among the team members boosted morale.
meanings.sent3: The indraughts of laziness made it hard for him to get out of bed in the morning.
meanings.sent4: His indraughts of determination pushed him to finish the race despite the pain.
meanings.sent5: The indraughts of kindness in the community created a supportive and caring environment.
